Description: Flint and limestone ostracon: on one side only, seven lines of a complete but rubbed text: a list of the 'money' given as payment for a bed by the lady Khanub to the workman Kenherkhopeshef, which adds up to a total of 19 'deben' of copper.
Curator's comments: Khanub and Kenherkhopeshef are both children of the famous lady Naunakht. Bibliography: J.J Janssen, 'Commodity Prices in the Ramesside Period' (Leiden, 1975), p.29.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (136385) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/136385)
